titleStmt.title: Samuel G. Suddarth, Receipt to John Haly
CWG13685

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.idno: QMG Box 11; Bundles of AG & QMG Expenditures 1864-65; Bundle 3

body.p:
NO. 12.
The State of Kentucky,
To John Haly, Dr.

row.cell: To one three quart Cup 45¢ one pan $100 one Bucket 60¢
" one coffin $8.00. Cotton, socks, &, Gloves $3.85. Coffin 8.00
" Fixing stove $100 one pot. &. one skillit $200 sprinkling pot $100
" Two looking glasses 90¢ each one clock furnished $800
" Six cards from commonwealth office $1.75 one claw hammmer 70¢
" Five Lights Glass put in $2.50 4 lb of Nails 32¢
" one large dish pan $125 one spoon 20¢ coffee Boiler 80¢
" Salt Seller & spit Boxes 75¢. Saw dust form Harrod $120
" Brass Bound Bucket $3,50 Six setts of Knives & Forks $810
" one sifter 35¢ one axe and hander $2.00. one milk can 50¢
" Rodman &. Blackburn bill $20.88 one hand axe $125
" 18 lb of storm pipe $3.96 putting same up 75¢
" one dish scales 50¢ Six lamp chimneys $1.50. Two Locks $1.60
" one closett Lock 35¢ one Meat Saw $200 Three chambers & lids $375

body.p: I certify that the above account is correct and just, and that the articles were furnished as stated, and were necessary for the public service.

Wm H. Gardner
Surgeon in Charge Hospital
Quarter-Master Gen. of Ky.

Received at Frankfort, Kentucky, the 21 of March, 1864, of S. G. SUDDARTH, Quarter=Master General for the State of Kentucky, the sum of Ninety Six dollars and Eight cents, in full of the above account.
(DUPLICATE.)

19
No 12.
No 46 Abstract. G
Jno Haly
Dollars 96 08/100
Paid March 21st 1864
Hospital
J 235
certif no 19
